result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Joseph Casey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Dismissed 16CT122, 16CM133, 16CM29, 16CM177, 16CM134, 16CM145.
*Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing the the event of probation revocation. 

Concurrent with: Count 2 (16CM144)

miscConds.notes: *Payable through Clerk of Court. Apply bond on file and return remaining bond to payor.

*AODA and any other treatment recommended by the agent. 
*Complete a domestic abuse assessment. Court accepts Ms. Sather MS, LPC assessment. 
*Regular and random testing. 
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
*  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Wayne S or Carley S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud   DF:  Cody Joseph Casey appeared. Case called at 11:30. Includes 16CT122, 16CM133, 16CM144, 16CM29, 16CM177, 16CM145, 16CM134. ADA Kelly updates the court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1, 2  in 16CM144. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 2 in 16CM144. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses with prejudice 16CT122, 16CM133, 16CM29, 16CM177, 16CM145, 16CM134. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H 
Ct. 1 
1 year probation with conditions:
- DE to complete a domestic abuse assessment Court is ok with Ms. Sather's assessment. 
- DE to complete AODA and any other treatment recommended by the agent. 
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Wayne S. or Carley S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- Random and reqular testing. 
- Costs of $243.00.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00

Ct. 2
 1 year probation concurrent to count 1.
  Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- DE to complete a domestic abuse assessment. Court is ok with Ms. Sather's assessment. 
- DE to complete AODA and any other treatment recommended by the agent. 
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Wayne S. or Carley S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. - Random and reqular testing. 
- Costs of $243.00. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.

Any balance to be returned to the payor. 
Costs of probation to be paid while on probation. 
Court lifts any suspensions of DL for non payment and reinstates payment plan. 
Atty's to calculate credit time within 10 days. 
DE to report to probation today. 
Court orders treatment records to be sealed in the file.

ADDRESS INFO for Cody Joseph Casey
Current: 832 Mcutcheon Rd., Hudson, WI 54016 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2016)
Prior: 630 Ron Drive, New Richmond, WI 54017 
Per Def's bond. km

**AMENDED**
Includes 16CM133, 16CM134, 16CM144, 16CM145  and 16CM177

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wayne S. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Carli S and Susan D.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- DE to PBT testing every Mon. Thurs. and Sat. by 6:30pm at St. Croix County Jail. 

- DE to maintain current counseling. 

- DE not to talk to Carli S. or Susan D. about any of DE pending charges. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Arne Richard Skatrud DF: Cody Joseph Casey appeared. Case called at 4:05.  Includes 16CM133, 16CM134, 16CM144, 16CM145, 16CM177. ADA Kelly updates the court, there is a lot of discovery in all the files. Atty. Skatrud agrees. State objects to amending to NAC at this time. It is the victim's  wishes to have the NC stay as a condition of the bond. Atty. Skatrud updates the court, DE is attending counseling through Ms. Kjolsing. Court appoints Atty. Skatrud to 16CM177. Court reviews bond on 16CM133, 16CM134, 16CM144, 16CM145. ADA Kelly updates the court as to a NC regarding to Susan D.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus,  DF:  Cody Joseph Casey appeared from jail via video.   Includes 16CM133, 16CM134, 16C144 & 16C145.  Court confirms address. Defendant does not qualify for PD.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all Counts/Cases.  Reserve speedy trial. ADA Nieskes is requesting $1000.00 CB, Atty Firkus argues.  State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.
